definition: lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
to build/to construct/to ram/to hit/Taiwan pr. [zhu2]

sentences.english: He was deep in debt and faced with forfeiture of his property.
sentences.chinese: 他債臺高築，面對他的是財產的沒收。

sentences.english: Despite this, he was so extravagant that he was always in debt.
sentences.chinese: 儘管收入不少，但他揮霍無度，經常債臺高築。

sentences.english: St. Nicholas learned about a man who was hopelessly in debt.
sentences.chinese: 聖尼古拉得知，有個人因債臺高築而深感絕望。

sentences.english: Most big firms paid silly prices for companies using sillier levels of debt.
sentences.chinese: 不少行業巨頭爲債臺高築的企業開出天價。
